column5: I pick up by 185 Lund Tyee today.  It has sat in the Grand River every summer and is stained from the water line down.  I am looking for some advice or products to help get this cleaned up.  Your help would be appreciated.  Thanks.
Go fishing with it.......if "someday" you have time, try power washing it.
Like billy said take it fishing for a day then clean it after as it will soften the scum. As for what cleaner I am not sure.

magic eraser may work - but it is a micro-abrasive pad so that is your call. It should remove it. After that spray a vinegar/water mix on it and wipe after loading on the trailer - I just started doing this and it gets rid of water spots.

I have tried several cleaners today and had little success.  The boat has been dry docked since last fall.  I think I will take her fishing and let it soak for a few hours in fresh water. Hopefully that will loosen things up a bit.
Javex and  water in a squirt bottle .

Starbrite Hull cleaner. Available at Cdn Tire. Mix 50/50 in a spray bottle with water. Wet hull with hose, spray on, leave for a few minutes, get a car wash brush, give quick little scrub and hose off. VOILA!! Never fails.
Would a high pressure washer help if used with some of the cleaners mentioned?
yep, my boat is in the Erie for 8 months a year and it makes it like new every time
Picked up some Starbrite Hull Cleaner today.  I will let you all know how I make out.  Thanks for all the tips.
You don't need a pressure hose. Regular garden hose works just fine.
Let us know how you make out. I got the same thing on my boat just from day trips to the Grand.

X4 on the Starbrite Hull Cleaner from CTC. Been using it on my aluminum for 4 years now; no problems such as eating the paint or dulling paint etc. Just follow instructions and I follow up with a coating of carnuuba wax.
